info.title: Runpath.Holdings
info.description:
A service for representing parties and their financial owned items # About Holdings is a CRUD API and Data Store where ‘Persons’ and their associated ‘OwnedItems’ are held. OwnedItems are representations of a Person's various financial interests: these can include Bank Accounts, Mortgages, Loans, Plans etc. # Authentication To utilise the Holdings Service, a bearer token must be issued along with the request. Details on how to obtain a bearer token, and how to utilise it as part of the request are detailed in the [Runpath Platform Authentication Guide](/document/PlatformAuthentication). To obtain an access token, follow the instructions in the Platform Authentication guide and add the following scopes:
Scopes | ------------- | holdings.read | holdings.readwrite |

get.summary: Get collection of change records

parameters.name: since
parameters.description: The start date to filter from

parameters.name: changeLevel

get.summary: Get Equity by Id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique id of the Equity.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique indetifier for the equity to update.

parameters.name: equity
parameters.description: The equity that will replace the existing equity

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the equity to delete.

get.summary: Gets an array of all Equities or a subset.

parameters.name: equityCode
parameters.description: Equity code to filter on.

parameters.name: equityCodeScheme
parameters.description: Equity Code Scheme. When this is supplied equity code must also be supplied.

parameters.name: equities
parameters.description: An array of equities to update. The equities to replace are determinded by the equity id.

post.summary: Recalculates the current value of all equities in the system. This is part of an equity import process.

get.summary: Gets a single fund by it's id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The fund id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the fund to update.

parameters.name: fund
parameters.description: The fund that is used to replace the existing fund

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the fund to delete.

get.summary: Gets an array of all funds or a subset of the funds.

parameters.name: fundCode
parameters.description: Filter on the fund code. When present code must also be specified.

parameters.name: fundCodeScheme
parameters.description: Filter on the code. When present the fundCode must also be specified.

parameters.name: funds
parameters.description: An array of funds to update. The funds to replace are determinded by the fund id.

post.summary: Recalculates the current value of all funds in the system. This is part of an fund import process.
